sentences.en: A letter headed'Advertising Mania'appeared in the paper.
sentences.cn: 报纸上出现了一封题为 “ 广告热”的信.

sentences.en: Any very strong interest or emotion, for Hawthorne, is next door to mania.
sentences.cn: 浓厚的兴趣或强烈的感情, 对霍桑来说, 都几近疯狂.

sentences.en: Collecting small items can easily become a mania.
sentences.cn: 收藏零星物品往往容易变成一种癖好.

sentences.en: He had a mania for fast cars.
Her mania has come to a crisis.
sentences.cn: 她那种神经错乱的毛病已经到了转变阶段.

sentences.en: Her name was Victoria, and she had a perfect mania for going to church.
sentences.cn: 她名叫维多利亚, 对上教堂去有一种狂热的爱好.

sentences.en: In his latter years religious mania clouded his mind.
sentences.cn: 晚年的时候，对宗教的狂热让他丧失心智。

sentences.en: It seemed to some observers that the English had a mania for travelling.
sentences.cn: 在某些观察家看来，英国人对旅行似乎抱有一种狂热。

sentences.en: Kleptomania is a mania for stealing things.
sentences.cn: 盗窃癖是一种爱偷东西的躁狂症.

sentences.en: She has a mania for ponies.
Strictly, mania is a kind of madness which makes people violent.
sentences.cn: 严格地说, 狂热是一种使人极端性的精神病.

sentences.en: The mania for dinosaurs began in the late 1800s.
sentences.cn: 恐龙热兴起于19世纪晚期。

sentences.en: The media have a mania about rugby union.
sentences.cn: 媒体格外青睐英式橄榄球联盟。

sentences.en: Then the horrid fact was disclosed that the new head had a mania for general information.
sentences.cn: 那么,从这种可怕的事实中就可以看出问题,新上司原来对广博知识有一种癖好.

sentences.en: There is positively a mania among some of them for sending it to England.'
sentences.cn: 有些客户确实发了疯,还想把财产送到英格兰来. ”

trans.tran_en: a strong desire for something or interest in something, especially one that affects a lot of people at the same time
